listitem.para: The binary release is a zip file containing an already built binary release of Restcomm JAIN SLEE
As an alternative to the binary release, it is possible to download a specific release source code and build a binary from it.
Similar as the Release Source Building, but done on the master (current development) source code.
The binary release snapshot is a build of the master source code done daily and upoaded to a public web site.

section.title: Binary Release
section.para: You can download the Binary zip files from .

procedure.para: In this form of installation, simply unzip the downloaded zip file to the directory of your choice on any operating system that supports the zip format.

step.title: Unzip the release file
step.para: Unzip the file to extract the archive contents into the location of your choice. You can do this using the JDK jar tool (or any other ZIP extraction tool). In the example below we are assuming you downloaded the zip file was named restcomm-jainslee-&THIS.VERSION;.zip to the /restcomm directory.

step.title: Setting up JBOSS_HOME Environment Variable
step.para: You should now have a directory called restcomm-jainslee-&THIS.VERSION;. Next you need to set your JBOSS_HOME environment variables. This is discussed in .

step.title: Downloading the source code

important.para: Git is used to manage Restcomm JAIN SLEE source code. Instructions for downloading, installing and using Git can be found at

step.para: Use Git to checkout the specific release source, the Git repository URL is https://code.google.com/p/jain-slee/ , then switch to the specific release version, lets consider &THIS.VERSION;.

step.title: Building the source code

important.para: Apache Ant 1.6 (or higher) and Maven 2.0.9 (or higher) is used to build the release. Instructions for using Ant and Maven2, including install, can be found at and

step.para: Use Ant to build the binary.
Once the process finishes you should have a restcomm-jainslee-&THIS.VERSION;.zip file, installation is the same as for .
